Elvis Presley - In The Ghetto

Standard tuning
CAPO 1

A * - Play the A with a hammer-on/pull-off (little finger on the 3rd fret of the B string to mimic the riff)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bu3SBtub53g if you want the pro picking version.


[Verse 1]
       [ch]A[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] *
As the snow flies
     [ch]C#m[/ch]
On a cold and grey Chicago mornin'
  [ch]D[/ch]                [ch]E[/ch]
A poor little baby child is born
       [ch]A[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] *
In the ghetto


[Verse 2]
       [ch]A[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] *
And his mama cries
          [ch]C#m[/ch]
'cause if there's one thing that she don't need
     [ch]D[/ch]              [ch]E[/ch]
It's another hungry mouth to feed
       [ch]A[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] *
In the ghetto


[Chorus]
                 [ch]E[/ch]
People don't you understand
                  [ch]D[/ch]       [ch]A[/ch]
The child needs a helping hand
   [ch]D[/ch]                   [ch]E[/ch]                    [ch]A[/ch]
Or he'll grow to be an angry young man some day
               [ch]E[/ch]
Take a look at you and me,
           [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]A[/ch]
Are we too blind to see..
[ch]D[/ch]            [ch]C#m[/ch]                [ch]Bm[/ch]             [ch]E[/ch]
Do we simply turn our heads and look the other way
        [ch]A[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] *
Well the world turns
     [ch]C#m[/ch]                        
And a hungry little boy with a runny nose
[ch]D[/ch]                          [ch]E[/ch]
Plays in the street as the cold wind blows
       [ch]A[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] *
In the ghetto


[Verse 3]
       [ch]A[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] *  
And his hunger burns
        [ch]C#m[/ch]
so he starts to roam the streets at night
       [ch]D[/ch]                           [ch]E[/ch]
And he learns how to steal, and he learns how to fight
       [ch]A[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] *
In the ghetto


[Chorus]
[ch]E[/ch]
Then one night in desperation
[ch]D[/ch]                  [ch]A[/ch]
A young man breaks away
[ch]D[/ch]              [ch]C#m[/ch]
He buys a gun, steals a car,
[ch]Bm[/ch]                    [ch]E[/ch]
Tries to run, but he don't get far
        [ch]A[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] *
And his mama cries
         [ch]C#m[/ch]    
As a crowd gathers 'round an angry young man
     [ch]D[/ch]                         [ch]E[/ch]    
Face down on the street with a gun in his hand
       [ch]A[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] *
In the ghetto


[Outro]

As her young man dies,
         [ch]C#m[/ch]
On a cold and grey Chicago mornin'
[ch]D[/ch]                   [ch]E[/ch]    
Another little baby child is born
       [ch]A[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] *
In the ghetto
        [ch]A[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] *
And his mama cries...

Capo 1

Tab by Már Kristjónsson [markristjonsson@gmail.com]
15. FEB 2005, Reykjavík

There is actually no guitar in some parts of the song so I didn't 
tab those parts (I still wrote down the chords). I recommend you just play 
those chords similarly to the 'C#m, D and E part' shown below or if you're in 
a band consider just not playing them.

 [ch]D[/ch]                  [ch]E[/ch]

[ch]A[/ch]|[ch]D[/ch]|[ch]A[/ch]|[ch]D[/ch]|[ch]A[/ch]|[ch]D[/ch]|[ch]A[/ch]
In the ghetto


BRIDGE I
                  [ch]C#min[/ch]
People, don't you understand
                  [ch]Dmaj[/ch]    [ch]Amaj[/ch]
The child needs a helping hand
   [ch]Dmaj[/ch]                [ch]Emaj[/ch]                 [ch]Amaj[/ch]
Or he'll grow to be an angry young man some day
               [ch]C#min[/ch]
Take a look at you and me,
           [ch]Dmaj[/ch]     [ch]Amaj[/ch]
Are we too blind to see,
Dmaj         C#(note) 
Do we simply turn our heads
    B/Dmaj         Emaj
And look the other way

VERSE III
[ch]A[/ch]|[ch]D[/ch]|[ch]A[/ch]|[ch]D[/ch]|[ch]A[/ch]|[ch]D[/ch]|[ch]A[/ch]
Well the world turns
And a hungry little boy with a runny nose
Plays in the street as the cold wind blows
In the ghetto

VERSE IV
And his hunger burns
So he starts to roam the streets at night
and he learns how to steal
And he learns how to fight
In the ghetto

BRIDGE II
Then one night in desperation
A young man breaks away
He buys a gun, steals a car,
Tries to run, but he don't get far
And his mama cries

VERSE V
As a crowd gathers 'round an angry young man
Face down on the street with a gun in his hand
In the ghetto

VERSE VI
As her young man dies,
On a cold and gray Chicago mornin',
Another little baby child is born
In the ghetto


Chord Structure consist of basically 3 patterns

Intro
Verses
Bridge

The timing of the Intro is the key and really makes the song.

Intro Riff A,D,A,D,A,D,A______

1    +    2    +    3    +    4      1    +    2    +    3    +    4   
          H    P    H    P    H----                     H   P   H  -----
|----------------------------------|------------------------------------|
|----2----3----2----3----2----3----|-----------2----2---3---2---3--2----|

|----2----4----2----4----2----4----|-----------2----2---4---2---4--2----|
|-0--------------------------------|-0----------------------------------|
|----------------------------------|------------------------------------|


Next the verses are a combo of Half the Intro Riff and a really nice
chord cadence

Verses

|   A,D,A,D,A,D,A   |     C#min      |       Dmaj      |       Emaj     
|   A,D,A,D,A,D,A   |

                                                             Walk down

C# ----- B/Dmaj------Emaj

     Walk down....

|------0-------------0--------2----------|
|-------------4------2--------2----------|

In the Ghetto - Elvis Presley

(Interpreted by ROCKGEBIET)

Standard guitar tuning. We arrenged the Song in C and not in the orig. key, and we play 
version with Lisa Marie and Elvis.

To get the typical hammer on/pull of sound I use the open C-chord and put one finger of 
fret on the thin E String. In the chords I write this as the following: Csus4

Try it and have fun!!!

content.text:
Title: In the Ghetto
Artist: Elvis Presley
by Maxo3
__________________________________________________________

Hi!
I wrote the chords as they are in the real song. They look
hard and ugly, but they are very simple and easy in the
way I show you.
__________________________________________________________

Riff 1:
This is based in Bb - Bbsus4
--------------------------------------------------------|
--------3-----3/4--3/4--3/4---------3-----3/4--3/4--3---|
-----3-----3--3----3----3--------3-----3--3----3----3---|
--------------------------------------------------------|
--1---------------------------1-------------------------|
--------------------------------------------------------|

Dm:  Eb:  F:    Bb:
-5-  -6-  --8-  -6-|
-6-  -8-  -10-  -6-|
-7-  -8-  -10-  -7-|
-7-  -8-  -10-  -8-|
-5-  -6-  --8-  -8-|
---  ---  ----  -6-|

         Riff 1
As the snow flies...
     [ch]Dm[/ch]
On a cold and grey Chicago morning
  Eb                 F                   Riff 1
A poor little baby child is born in the ghetto

        Riff 1
And his mamma cries...
         [ch]Dm[/ch]
'Cos if there's one thing that she dont need
        Eb            F                    Riff 1
It is another hungry mouth to feed in the ghetto

[Chorus 1]
                [ch]Dm[/ch]
People dont you understand
                  [ch]Eb[/ch]      [ch]Bb[/ch]
The child needs a helping hand
    [ch]Eb[/ch]               [ch]F[/ch]                [ch]Bb[/ch]
Or he'll gonna be an angry young man some day


[Chorus 2]
               [ch]Dm[/ch]
Take a look at you and me
            [ch]Eb[/ch]      [ch]Bb[/ch]
Are we too blind to see
   [ch]Eb[/ch]           [ch]Dm[/ch]                  [ch]Cm[/ch]
Or do we simply turn our heads and look the other way


Well, the world turns..
And a hungry little boy with a runny nose
Plays in the street as the cold wind blows in the ghetto

And his hunger burns...
So he starts to roam the streets at night
And he learns how to steal and he learns how to fight in the ghetto


[Chorus 2]
Then one night in desperation the young man breaks away
He buys a gun, he steals a car,
He tries to run but he dont get far


And his mamma cries...
As a crowd gathers round an angry young man
Face down in the street with a gun in his hand in the ghetto

And as her young man dies...
On a cold and grey Chicago morning
Another little baby child is born in the ghetto...

Max Hardy-Werbin

Song: In the ghetto (The vicious circle)
Artist: Elvis Presley
Composer: Mac Davis

Tabbed by DJ ('DiddyD' at ultimateGuitar.com)
29th July 2015

TUNING:
The original record is very slightly flat of concert pitch.
To match it, use a chromatic tuner and de-tune all strings by
approx. minus 10.  Alternatively, find a live version to play
along with, which is more likely to be in concert pitch.

CAPO: 3rd fret (Sounds in the recorded approx. key of Bb)

Chord names and fret positions are relative to the capo:
[ch]G[/ch]   = 320003     [ch]C[/ch]   = x32010    [ch]Am[/ch]    = x02210
[ch]C/G[/ch] = 3x2013     [ch]D7[/ch]  = xx0212    [ch]D[/ch]     = xx0232
[ch]Bm[/ch]  = x24432     [ch]C/B[/ch] = x2x010    [ch]Dsus4[/ch] = xx0233
h   = hammer-on                  [ch]Dsus2[/ch] = xx0230

The key to this song is in the hammered-on riff shown in the intro.
This riff carries on throughout large sections of the song.
Although the 1st and 5th strings don't actually need to be sounded,
you may find it easier to form the full G chord as anchorage, as it
feels stronger to me when adding the extra hammered-on notes.
I play the G chord using the middle finger on the 5th string, the ring 
finger on the 6th string and the little finger on the 1st string.
Then hammer-on the notes on the 2nd and 4th strings using the index
and middle fingers.

Please remember to select a star rating for this tab, thank you

Ghost Riders in the Sky


        First off, if you want just a simple version, ignore all the chords
in parentheses, and simply play the Em, G and C where indicated.  Strum in
a rythm that sounds like a galloping horse; you know, like the first few
opening bars to the theme from Bonanza (tum tada dum tada dum tada dum).

        On the other hand, you can make this simple song more interesting
with a few easy tricks.  The first is to play the bass line along with the
Em chord.  The bass line is easy, and goes...

E|----------------------------------|
B|----------------------------------|
G|----------------------------------|
D|----------------------------------|
A|-----1-2------1-2-------1-2-------|
E|--0-------0---------0---------0---|

...where the open sixth string (E) is a quarter note, the two notes on the
fifth string (Bb abd B, repectively) are eighth notes.  If you play the Em
chord as...

EADGBe
||1|||
|23|||
||||||

...(Yes, that's right; two fingers on the fifth string), you can play the
bass line while you strum the Em chord just by picking up and putting
down your 3rd finger.

        The changes to (C/E) and (A/E) are attempts to cover the sound
originally filled in by a couple of background singers singing "ah" on the
notes B, C, C#, C.  This works on acoustic guitar if you continue to strum
the low E (open sixth string) rather prominantly while playing the
following positions.

[ch]C/E[/ch]   (regular old [ch]C[/ch] position,      [ch]A/E[/ch]    or [ch]A7[/ch]/[ch]E[/ch]
EADGBe but with the low E played  EADGBe    EADGBe  (i.e., use your third
||||1| with a vengeance!)         ||||||    ||||||   finger to mute the
||2|||                            ||111|    ||||1|   4th string.  I prefer
|3||||                            ||||||    ||||||   this because the 
                                  |3||||    |3x|||   changes are smoother)

Good luck.  Send email or post if you have any questions.

[Intro]

[Verse 1]
[ch]E[/ch]                      [ch]B[/ch]    [ch]E[/ch]
In this country at any given time
[ch]E[/ch]

[ch]E[/ch]       [ch]C#m[/ch]                  [ch]E[/ch]

[ch]E[/ch]                    [ch]A[/ch]

            [ch]E[/ch]                [ch]C#m[/ch]                 [ch]E[/ch]

[ch]E[/ch]         [ch]B[/ch]           [ch]E[/ch]            [ch]C#m[/ch]

[ch]C#m[/ch]
But they don't make a sound

        [ch]B[/ch]                            [ch]C#m[/ch]
